dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bangs the man's head back against the wall.  The man starts babbling in Japanese. Ich, horrified, tries to pull Nick off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick bangs the snitches head against the wall again.  Ich gets Nick away.  The man is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man must be treated with respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich bows to the man, apologizes in Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue speaking in Japanese.  They bow to one another again.  Ich gives the man a glass of water, then motions for him to sit down. Nick, impatient, starts for the guy again.  Ich stops him The snitch holds up one of the photos, and starts babbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ich) Now we're making progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SALESGIRL behind the cosmetic counter.  She is wearing the store uniform:  blue and white dress and whit gloves.  A doll.  We shouldn't recognize her at first. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one of Kobo's porno pics.  It's the same face.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL NICK
dialogues.text: holding the photo, standing in the crowded store.  Ich is beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Kobo's girl?  He's sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich glances back at the man in the Hawaiian shirt standin by the door.  The man nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the girl help a customer choose an eyeliner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, no one's seen Kobo in three days.  He might not even be in Tokyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out... Get her up in the morning and put her to bed at night.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: is struggling with his chopsticks and bowl of noodles. From O.S. A LOUD SLURPING SOUND.  The sound stops, then starts again.  Nick can't eat.  He sets his bowl down and looks over at

dialogues.speaker: ICH
dialogues.text: slurping his noodles.  It is considered polite to slurp soba noodles as loud as possible. Ich stops.  Looks at Nick, then resumes his slurping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you could keep it to a dull roar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sitting by the window across from the Seibu department store watching the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods.  Picks up his bowl.  Again the LOUD slurping off screen.  Nick starts to eat the noodles.  He can't continue with Ich slurping.  He sets the bowl down. Ich grins, resumes slurping and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SALESGIRLS are lined up at the door bowing and thanking the last customers for shopping in their store. Standard practice. The GIRL whom Nick and Ich have been watching comes out wearing her uniform and heads down the street.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND ICH
dialogues.text: waiting in the restaurant, get up to follow.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: stepping out of the laundry carrying her wash.  She walks past a doorway where... NICK is standing. ICH now walks past his partner picking up the tail.  No acknowledgement between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are dozens of street cars waiting to pull out.  The girl is on one of them.  Ich has lost her.  Nick and Ich hurry from car to car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you could keep up with her! 'No problem, Nick-san.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting Ich off) No.  Don't say anything.  Don't do anything, and for Christ's sake, don't apologize!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hurries toward another car to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spot the girl sitting in the window of one of the street cars, about to turn onto the main street. The two cops race for the car.  Nick leaps on.  Ich is a few steps behind.  Nick sticks out his hand, pulls Ich up They stand looking at one another, both breathing hard, both out of shape.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTCLUB DISTRICT
dialogues.text: Narrow streets with exploding neon ideograph signs as far as the eye can see. We spot our girl hurrying down the street.  Nick, a half block behind, is bumping into people, trying not to lose her. She crosses the street and Ich picks her up.  Nick drops off.

dialogues.speaker: ON A SIDE STREET
dialogues.text: around the corner the girl disappears into a three story apartment building above an electronics store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're watching our girl inside her apartment.  She flips off the TV and climbs into bed.

dialogues.speaker: A STOREROOM
dialogues.text: We've been watching the girl from a window across the street.  It's a storeroom full of shipping crates, not much else.  Ich is sitting on the floor, legs crossed, back erect, watching Nick.  Nick glances over.  Ich continues to watch him.  Nick returns to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dislike me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick keeps looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You toler -- yes, tolerate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a joke.  They sent you to me to make a fool of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks over at Ich.  Ich is looking away.  Nick looks out the window, then back at his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing fine, Ich.  Now drop it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl switches off her light across the street.

dialogues.speaker: THE STOREROOM
dialogues.text: Ich is sleeping on his back looking like a grounded whale Nick, exhausted, is sitting by the window his head restin against the sill.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: as the girl, dressed in her store uniform, comes out of the apartment and heads for work.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: nudges the sleeping Ich with his foot.  Ich opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich is groggy, nonplused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich, tucking in his shirt, comes down the hall to see -- Nick, on his knees, examining the lock on the girl's apartment door.  He slides his NYPD card into the jam and lightly raps the knob plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick uses his sleeve to wipe prints off the knob and jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open.  Nick walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheesebox with a few vintage pieces of American deco furniture. Ich, very uptight, stands at the door while Nick goes ove the place. Nick opens the closet.  It's packed with expensive dresses, pants, sweaters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (facing him) If you're gonna give me a hard time, wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick goes through her chest of drawers:  on the top, a lo of high quality lingerie. INSERT PHOTO:  The girl and Kobo posing in a vintage Corvette. Nick replaces the picture, and carefully rearranges the drawer so it appears untouched.  He pulls open another drawer.  Then another.  Under the jeans and Mickey Mouse T-shirts, he finds:

dialogues.speaker: A BANK STACK OF U.S. CURRENCY
dialogues.text: in hundreds.  The bottom of the drawer is lined with stacks.  Nick holds them up for Ich to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too shabby for a perfume pusher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich, shocked, tries to play it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad it's not in yen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shoves the drawer shut.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: The GIRL buys fruit from a stand as NICK watches from one end of the block; ICH, listening to his transistor radio, waits at the other.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: suddenly turns and finds herself facing

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: a few yards away.   Nick smiles, then walks into the store, hoping he hasn't been made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, leaning against the wall, watches the girl's apartment across the street.  The girl walks in, turns on her light, then disappears into the bathroom. Ich walks in, exhausted, soaked to the skin.  He tosses his cap in the corner.  Struck out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work, lunch, groceries, laundry... Fabulous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back out the window) Four goddamn days.  This is going nowhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich opens the door.  Joyce, dressed for work, is carrying two odons (box dinners).  Joyce and Ich exchange greeting in Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the latest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get him, Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce peeks out the window.  The girl is getting undressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ever pull down her shades?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right back at her) Sure, but then I just pull out the photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich opens one of the box dinners and sets it on the ledge in front of Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) Chikuwa, Hampen, Kobu, Konnayaku, Ganmodoki --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichiro --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) Broiled fish paste cake, Kelp roll, soybean curd, devils tongue --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like Bayonne at low tide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce hands Ich a flask of hot sake in tinfoil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick grabs the flask.  Dumps it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tosses a few thousand yen on the table.  Then, spotting something out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley oop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick grabs his coat and goes out the door.  Joyce slips Ich another flask of sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our GIRL standing alone on the corner of the street but you wouldn't know it at first.  She's wearing tight leather pants, red leather jacket, earrings, bright red lipstick, and she's dumped the pony-tail, allowing her hair to fall to her waist.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND ICH
dialogues.text: watching in a doorway down the block.  Nick's shivering, his hands thrust in his army surplus jacket.  Ich doesn't mind the cold.  He's had his sake.

dialogues.speaker: THREE BOSOZOKU
dialogues.text: riding their bikes come around the corner drive past her, then circle back. One of the RIDERS stops to talk to her, then drives off. She hurries off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yakuza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Very good...

dialogues.speaker: A SUBWAY STATION
dialogues.text: The girl waits until the last minute, then after glancing back, steps in the car.  The train pulls out.  The cars race past until we see -- Nick and Ich standing inside of the last car.  It disappears into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHINZOA DISTRICT
dialogues.text: The girl, on the move, pushing through the crowd.  Drop back to find Ich twenty yards behind.  She crosses the street.  Nick, pretending to be looking in a store window picks her up.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Nick has lost her.  It's a cul de sac with a dozen buildings.  He's standing in the middle of the street. Ich catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappeared... shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were too far behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick does a double-take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recalling Nick's words) Don't say anything more.  Don't do anything.  And, for Christ's sake, don't apologize!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: dropping another cigarette butt to the ground.  There's a small pile at his feet.  He's leaning against the wall watching one end of the block.  TRACK over to reveal Ich, his back to Nick's, watching the other end. Ich glances back at Nick.  Nick ignores him.  Ich turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicklaus-san!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to see the GIRL walk out of a bath house. She's wearing her ponytail again, with a black dress.  Sh climbs into a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl climbs out of the taxi and goes inside. Nick and Ich are watching from across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with Salarymen from the nearby brewery and hostesses in silk dresses selling cheap champagne at expensive prices.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND ICH
dialogues.text: Walk in.  Everything seems normal. The BOUNCER in a white tux, stops them.  This is not a place frequented by Gaiijin. Ich beseeches the Bouncer to let his good friend in, promising that his friend will spend lots of money. Nick, thinking he's in, takes a step forward.  The Bounce shoves him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no hands, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bats his hands away.  Ich grabs Nick by the shoulders, preventing a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come in.  They don't want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaiijin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, unsure, turns to go, but before he does:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I smell one drop of Scotch on your breath, my friend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hesitates, he's not so sure, then shoves the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick waiting under the pink neon sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich is sitting at the crowded bar.  A HOSTESS has her arm around his neck.  He checks out the room, searching for the girl.  He notices two THUGS standing outside a slidin door.  Ich finishes his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Let me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoving him down) Sit, sweetie. (to bartender) Another Seagrams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich relents.  Then, spotting something across the room: WHAT HE SEES:  A rice paper door slides open, momentarily revealing a DOZEN men with close cropped hair sitting on tatami mats, playing poker.  Some have their coats off, revealing arms covered with tattoos.  Yakuza. A hostess, serving drinks, steps but leaving the door partially open. The hostess slides the door open to the adjacent room, bu Ich CANNOT see inside.  She slides it shut. Ich's hostess wants him to buy another drink, but Ich shakes his head, gets to his feet, and pretending to be drunk, stumbles toward the sliding doors. Ich bumps into a table; slaps a stranger on the shoulder; then starts singing along with Frank Sinatra on the stereo.  He's a little too loud, a little off key. The bodyguards eye Ich suspiciously.  He stumbles past them, then grabs the sliding door and yanks it open.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ROOM
dialogues.text: A low table.  Kobo is at one end.  An older, distinguished, sliver-haired man in his seventies whom we will come to know as SUGAI is at the other.  Ich can't believe his eyes:  Sugai is the head of the largest Yakuz syndicate in Japan. A half dozen LIEUTENANTS sit on either side of the table. Half are older, dressed in conservative suits; the other half are younger wearing $700 Issy Miyake jackets.

dialogues.speaker: SUGAI AND KOBO
dialogues.text: are having a heated discussion.  The GIRL Ich and Nick have been following walks over to Kobo and sits beside him.  This makes Sugai even more irate.  He's on his feet red faced and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR GUARDS
dialogues.text: seeing Ich, pull out their Beretta's.  Two more grab him and fling him head first against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drunken, in Japanese) I have to piss, gentlemen... I'm so sorry but I have to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodyguards hurry him towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick checks his watch, it's been an hour - where the hell is Ich? Ich comes stumbling up the steps, still affecting his drunken, pigeon-toed walk.  Nick, of course, thinks Ich has gotten drunk again.  Two of the bodyguards are watching from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it... (grabs him) Son-of-a-bitch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich, knowing they're being watched, grabs Nick by the sleeve and drags him off still pretending to be drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) I'm not drunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're through.  I mean it.  This is the end of the line, Matsumoto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No longer fearing he's being watched, Ich abruptly stops his affected walk, and sounding very sober --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut-up! (then) Kobo is inside.  He's with Sugai, the head of the Summaguchi-clan.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: Ich is dialing on the police call box as he fills Nick in on Sugai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A Godfather.  His man was killed at the printing plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to yank Kobo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not without a small army, Nicklaus- san.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich quickly speaks on the police phone, then hangs up, pleased with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich, my name is Nick.  Not Nicklaus, not Nicklaus-san, not Nick-san. Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San is an honorable title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich realizes it's better to drop it.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSTESS CLUB
dialogues.text: Drunken Salarymen spill out the door.

dialogues.speaker: ICH AND NICK
dialogues.text: are standing across the street waiting for the cops to arrive. Nick freezes.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: they've been following steps out and lights a cigarette. TIME SLOWS.  She looks up and spots the two men through the traffic.  Nick turns away, afraid he's been made. When he looks back, she's gone back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick races across the street toward the club.  Horns BLARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't understand) Nick?!

dialogues.speaker: IN FRONT OF THE CLUB
dialogues.text: Nick reaches the curb just as the front doors to the club BURST OPEN.  He's too late.  Three bodyguards burst out, checking the street.  A red and white Debonnaire pulls up Sugai, surrounded by a half-dozen additional bodyguards, comes out and slips into the car.  It tears off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: SIRENS AND POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: from either end of the street peel around the corner. It's a madhouse.  The remaining lieutenants and bodyguard fan out, trying to elude arrest. Nick hurries down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CLUB
dialogues.text: The patrons are still in place, but the two side rooms ar empty. Nick spots KOBO going out the rear entrance.  He starts after him but is confronted by the bouncer who stopped hi earlier.  Nick connects to the guy's jaw before his adversary can raise his hands.  The bouncer staggers back Nick flies out the rear door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several lieutenants and bodyguards toss their guns -- possession is a felony in Japan -- as the police close in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich hurries in, but Nick's long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE.  The narrow streets are deserted.  Nick slowly makes his way down the street.  The SOUND of a GUNSHOT. Nick ducks for cover -- it's a car BACKFIRING.  He continues on. Nick's POV of a woman giving a man a blow-job in a narrow alley.  The man's face is hidden by the shadow. Nick continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People like Charlie are a dime a dozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns back to see Kobo as he steps into the light. Kobo tosses a handful of change at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl takes off down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the street, a dozen bodyguards appear from various doorways and alleys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie was a rookie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo traces his finger across the spot where he cut Nick in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But you can take care of yourself.  You're 'the biggest thing to hit this town since Godzilla.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances at the guards, then back at Kobo.  He is unarmed.  To make a move would be suicide.  More POLICE SIRENS in the b.g. closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter.  I'm right in front of you, Nick. (takes a step closer) But I was right in front of you when you let Charlie die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo takes a step forward.  His face is inches from Nick's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away again.  Maybe you'll get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doesn't budge. A LONG BEAT, then... Nick turns and slowly walk off. After a dozen yards Nick looks back. The street is empty, except for a street sweeper pushing his wet broom down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half dozen bodyguards are being frisked, then shoved into police cars. Ohashi is talking to the enraged nightclub owner.  Nick steps up to him.  Ich hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ohashi) A few minutes faster, we might've nailed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohashi doesn't say a word, hands Nick a document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your visa has expired.  Be on a plane in twenty-four hours or you will be deported.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you were hanging out at the visa office, we found the son-of-a- bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohashi directs Nick's attention across the street where a SURVEILLANCE VAN is parked.  The rear doors are open revealing a van full of surveillance equipment and cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ruined an on-going investigation that could have gotten us more than one runner. (to Ich, in Japanese) I want a full report in the morning, officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich bows as Ohashi walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you'd work with us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohashi ignores him, continues walking toward his waiting car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Hey...! (Ohashi keeps walking) HEY, I'M TALKING TO YOU, INSPECTOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his back toward Nick) Twenty-four hours, detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohashi slips into his car.  Nick storms up to the car and slams his fist on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohashi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohashi faces straight ahead, ignoring Nick.  Nick takes the extradition paper and spikes it on the car antenna. Ich grabs Nick by his arm, pulling him back from the car. The car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick whirls, and before he realizes what he's doing, punches Ich below his left eye.  Ich stumbles back over the curb and lands on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit, Ichiro, I'm tired of people telling me what I can and can't do. No one ever solved anything sitting on their ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, beside himself with frustration, watches Ohashi's car disappear down the block.

dialogues.speaker: ON ICH
dialogues.text: looking up at

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: who walks off without looking back at his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, standing beside the tub, dumps a pail of hot water over his head, rinsing himself off.  He grabs a towel and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich, holding an ice pack to his face, is lying on a tatam mat against the wall looking up at the ceiling.  An open bottle of Seagrams beside him. Nick stretches out on another tatami on the opposite side of the room and looks up at the ceiling, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ice help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing from Ich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does this Sugai live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) A resort city, Beppu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he knows how to get to our man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never speak to a Gaiijin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be a nice Gaiijin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gets up and goes to the closet.  He slides open the door.  All of his and Charlie's clothes have been neatly hung up. He shoves Charlie's jacket aside.  Something's wrong with the way it hangs.  He pulls the jacket out, runs his hand over the coat, feeling something heavy in the lining. Nick rips the lining open.  Charlie's .32 Beretta and a spare clip tumble out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little bastard.  God bless him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich takes a drink from his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's illegal, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a new deal. (putting it in his waist band) ... coming with me tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai's not going to be impressed with your gun, Nick. (beat) No.  I won't put myself in danger for you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick picks up the liquor cap which rolled across the floor.  He tosses it to Ich.  Ich reaches for it, but misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, pal.  You've got better things to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks out shutting the door behind him.  Stay on Ich watching the door, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last customers find their way to the street, some wit a little encouragement from a BOUNCER. Joyce steps out.  Nick comes up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where I can get a decent cup of coffee this time of night? I'm buying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody must be suffering somewhere, you're being so nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce takes off down the street.  Nick watches her for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help, Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unavailable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the stage, a young professional looking man is singing along to "SUMMERTIME" blasting from the stereo.  The Japanese way of letting it all hang out. We find Joyce and Nick at a corner table having a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of Sugai.  I've also heard of the emperor.  They're both national treasures.  One's a hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need someone to translate for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Japanese isn't that hot... Besides, you'll never get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my last shot.  I have to be on a plane home tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm supposed to care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could fake it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce finishes her drink, sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neon flickers on the rain slicked pavement.  Nick and Joyce walk down the deserted street.  She's carrying an umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong to sell Ich short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shrugs, everyone's got a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His son hooked up with some bikers. Yakuza kids.  A cop shot him running from a robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks over for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A father doesn't out live that kind of thing here, much less a police officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You met her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman in the apartment.  She won't speak to him.  But she won't leave either.  Japan... Nice, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Nick can respond, something catches his eye:  What he sees --

dialogues.speaker: A MAN
dialogues.text: partially shadowed, standing in the alley. Nick grabs his gun.  The man steps out zipping up his trousers.  It's a drunken Salaryman.  Nick lowers his gun The Salaryman staggers down the street singing to himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not wound too tight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A three story modern building on a quiet street.  She's searching for her keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd invite you up but I know you'd hate the incense. (as if to explain) I chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you chant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Nam oyo ranged kyo.'  You think it's dumb of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if it works. (holding the door open for her) I'll meet you at the train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember saying yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember you saying no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce smiles, heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich is sleeping. Nick slips into his leather motorcycle jacket.  He drops Charlie's gun into his pocket.  He glances down at Ich, seeing if he's awake.  He's not.  Nick walks out. Ich opens his eyes.  He's been awake the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: THE YANAKA CEMETERY
dialogues.text: Ich, wearing a blue suit, is pouring water over a simple stone with a wooden dipper.  Next, he places incense in a holder and folds his hands in prayer. The photo on the stone is of a young man wearing a school uniform.  Ich's son.

dialogues.speaker: A BULLET TRAIN
dialogues.text: It's bull's-eye nose cone scuds across the endless rice paddies west of Tokyo.  Women in straw hats stand in the knee deep water pruning the rice by hand.  Old Japan rubbing shoulders with the new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON NICK looking out the window as the countryside shoots past at 140 mph.  From O.S. several children chanting:  "Harrow, Harrow." Nick looks over to see three uniformed school children thrusting their notebooks and pens at him.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: is sitting across from Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want your autograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little guy thinks you're Robert Redford... the other one thinks you're Charles Bronson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does, but the kids insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll never go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, reluctantly signs.  Joyce takes one of the kid's notebooks before passing it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick Jagger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce smiles, surprised at his choice.  Then, she looks u shocked to see --

dialogues.speaker: ICH
dialogues.text: carrying a gift wrapped package under his arm.  He's wearing his hat, blue suit and tie. Ich sits ACROSS the aisle from Nick and Joyce.  He doesn' say a word.  Faces straight ahead. Nick looks at Joyce, then back at Ich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Ichiro.  I lost it last night.  I shouldn't have hit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing from Ich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still not facing him) For Sugai.  Caviar, French cheese, ham... If you come to apologize for interrupting his meeting, Sugai may feel obligated to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I bring some cheese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gifts are expected here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods, looks back out the window.  He'll never understand this country.  He looks back to see -- Joyce looking annoyed at him.  Nick gets the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ich... Thanks.  I'm glad you're here.  I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich still won't acknowledge Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bullet Train disappearing into the foothills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumes of white steam spindle skyward from every street corner.  If you didn't know it was steam, you'd think the city was on fire.  Beppu is a resort famous for it's geothermal baths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only traditional house we'll see in our story.  It's surrounded by a pool of blood red steaming water from the hot springs.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE GATE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A 1000 yen bill as it is dropped on the ground. A pair of dice rolls over it.  A handful of GUARDS wearin suits and ties are playing craps.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE GATE
dialogues.text: Ich is sitting on the ground leaning against the wall, sound asleep.  Nick is standing nearby.  He checks his watch.  Tired of waiting, he walks over to --

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: reading the Manichi Daily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) They took the gift an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings inside the gate.  A guard picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (certain it's bad news) All's not lost.  There's a famous temple here.  We could chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard hangs up, calls out to Joyce.  Joyce responds i Japanese.  The guard opens the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheese...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast, austere, traditional room with sliding rice paper doors and tatami mats on the floor. Ich and Joyce, drinking tea, are sitting with their feet beneath them in the traditional manor. Nick, smoking, is in a semi-sprawl; using his tea cup as an ashtray. A LIEUTENANT enters.  He says something and beckons.  The all rise.  He says something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Just you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters, ducking his head in the low doorway.  the shoji slides shut behind him. The furnishings are minimal but elegant.  There's a butsudan, a tokonoma, and a low, long table in the middle of the room.  No chairs.  Nick sits on the floor. A door slides open at the far end of the room.  Sugai, wearing a kimono over western style suit, walks in.  Nick stands up to shake his hand.  Sugai ignores it, and sits in the traditional position:  feet tucked beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll spare you the ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses him a palm sized bundle.  Nick catches it. Inside, are brand new greenbacks:  hundreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This supposed to impress me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick it up.  Look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hesitates, then picks it up again.  He runs his fingers over the face of the bill and snaps the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years work by the finest engraver.  Mass produced, sequentially numbered.  The best there has ever been, Mr. Conklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed.  But let's use the short form.  I'm looking for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kobo... I know.  He killed two of my partners.  One in New York, one at the printing plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai fills a cup of tea for Nick and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai hands it to him anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took Kobo from the street.  I gave him a home, a future... But my ways were too slow for him... I served seven years in prison for my boss when I was a young man.  Kobo wouldn't serve seven minutes for his Oyabun. (sipping his tea) He was supposed to take over this syndicate when I retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be dealt with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai sets a plastic wrapped object on a table before Nick.  Nick recognizes it from the restaurant massacre in New York. CLOSE UP:  Nick's fingers tear at the plastic.  A block o black iridescent polymer.  The negative image of a $100.0 bill.  A printing plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our associates in New York were close to closing a deal with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The families who control the casinos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Unlike our syndicates, your criminals don't understand the words 'honor' and 'duty'... We can't afford not to deal with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai takes the plate back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine if your families could pay their gambling and drug debts with perfect counterfeit bought for cents on the dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Feds would be onto you in a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with these bills.  And even if it only took them six months, do you know what our profit margin would be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at a child playing near one of the hot pools i Sugai's garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why tell me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other plate is currently in New York, in the hands of Kobo's man. Find it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick laughs at Sugai's audaciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the counterfeit bills) With these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swiss bank deposit.  Gold bullion. Whatever you want.  You know the city and the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I say no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're smarter than Kobo.  You know the price of deceit.  Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai cools.  Without a word he gets to his feet and starts toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have ten hours to grab my man.

dialogues.speaker: ON SUGAI
dialogues.text: still walking with his back to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai turns to see Nick, across the room, pointing the Beretta at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room where Ich and Joyce are waiting.  Sugai enters. Their surprise turns to shock when they see Nick behind him holding a gun to the old man's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.  Him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. (to Joyce) You don't have to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't moved a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: INT SUGAI'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Sugai watches calmly as Nick, Ich, and Joyce put their shoes on.  Nick keeps the gun on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick steps out of the house.  He now has one end of a wir coat hanger loosely wrapped around Sugai's neck, the othe end around his wrist.  His gun is pressed just beneath Sugai's ear.  If nick gets shot, so does Sugai. A handful of guards stand in the courtyard, one is polishing Sugai's Debonnaire car.  They spot Nick and Sugai coming, and immediately pull their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain to them.  They shoot me, they kill you. (Sugai hesitates) DO IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai explains to his lieutenants.  They stand helpless a Nick walks Sugai toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab the keys, Ich, and get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, man, okay, not now.  Work with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich takes the keys from the man polishing the car.  He gets inside.  Joyce hurries in bedside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slides Sugai in the back seat, carefully reaches ove and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slide over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce, furious at Nick, starts the car, gets behind the wheel.  Ich gets in on the other side. She spins the car around.  The gate opens.  They tear off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car bursts through the funnels of steam from the hot- springs beneath the street.  It tears down the narrow block dodging traffic.  Joyce is concentrating hard on th road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ich) Where's somewhere safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing from Ich.  He's still apoplectic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) You came up with the first part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A four story concrete hotel, strictly for making love. "Love Hotels" exist all over Japan.  Each have various themes:  western, fifties drive in, Star Wars, etc., each complete with music and lighting effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Western style.  Plastic five foot cacti in front of the western vista on the walls.  A hitching post at the head of the bed.  Cowboy hats and boots at the other end. Sugai hangs up the phone and turns to Nick and Joyce who are sitting nearby.  Ich hangs up the extension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo will meet me here tomorrow. Ten a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich nods, confirming that what Sugai says is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll find out you took me.  I'm unprotected.  He'll kill us.  All of us.  You don't stand a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich, knowing Sugai is right, looks at Nick.  Nick flips Ich the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if we're careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich checks to make sure the gun is loaded, then watches a Nick escorts Joyce out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: A HOTEL ROOM ACROSS THE HALL
dialogues.text: Fifties theme.  The front end of a pink chevy curves around the bed.  A "Drive-In" movie screen along one wall Nick is dropping change into the vintage Wurlitzer.  Joyc steps in, leaving the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.  I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get Ich killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's keeping him here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, Nick.  And don't tell me this is all just about Charlie. It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That pushes her over the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves toward him, enraged.  Nick grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grips her tighter.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Nick and Joyce, only partially undressed, are making love on the floor.  The Drifters singing "Under The Boardwalk" can be heard on the Wurlitzer.  The fifties decor, the music, it's all pretty incongruous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is putting Joyce in a taxi.  He shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think you're a bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I chant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't help. (beat) Watch out for Ich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.  The cab drives off.  Nick watches her taxi unti it is out of sight, around a corner, then heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: walking into Sugai's room.  Sugai's asleep on the bed. Ich is vigilantly sitting awake in the corner, the gun resting on the table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better wake him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  The wind twirls a discarded newspaper in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LOVE HOTEL
dialogues.text: A YOUNG GIGGLING COUPLE step out of a door, arm in arm, and disappear down the hall.  STAR WARS MUSIC from one room.  HAWAIIAN MUSIC from another. THE CAMERA FINDS the closed elevator door.  It opens, Kob steps out, followed by a half-dozen more men all carrying Sig-Saur assault rifles -- very heavy artillery.

dialogues.speaker: SUGAI
dialogues.text: wearing his hat and coat is sitting on the couch, his bac to us, facing out the window. Drop down to --

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOM BENEATH HIM
dialogues.text: A couple are making love in the Hawaiian theme room. The door burst open.  Two men, cradling Sig-Saur rifles i their arms, step in.  They aim at the ceiling, blasting into Sugai's room above.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: starts screaming.  The men ignore her and continue to pum bullets into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: stop in front of every door long enough to blast into the room.  They make their way down the hall. A naked man steps into the hallway and is matter-of-factl gunned down. Kobo and his men stop in front of Sugai's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai, wearing his hat, is slumped down on the couch whic has been splintered by the bullets from below.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Kobo signals the men.  All six open-up through the door.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The door, what's left of it, is kicked open.  The six men step in, shooting in all directions:  into the bathroom door, into the closet... Windows shatter, mirrors fall, total destruction.  They stop.  SILENCE. Kobo walks up to Sugai who is slumped on the couch.  He lifts up his hat.  It's a cowboy mannequin wearing Sugai' clothes.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR DOOR
dialogues.text: opens.  A DOZEN of Sugai's men carrying machine pistols come out.

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTSIDE BALCONY
dialogues.text: Nick and Ich lie on their bellies, guns out.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Kobo's men turn.  Sugai's men open-up.  Three of Kobo's hitters go down.  The others try to flee into the adjoining room. Kobo goes for the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: THE BALCONY
dialogues.text: as Kobo steps out.  He steps right into --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: who slams the side of Kobo's head with the butt of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Nick and Ich drag Kobo in by his jacket collar.  Sugai, very much alive, walks in from the hallway.  Nothing is said.  Sugai looks at Kobo for a long beat, then walks out.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: standing alone in the middle of a tatami room.  His face is badly beaten.  His hands are bound.  Two guards stand near the wall.  Nick and Ich stand across the room.

dialogues.speaker: SUGAI
dialogues.text: wearing a western suit, is asking Kobo questions in Japanese.  Sugai barks at him again.  Kobo refuses to answer.  Sugai pulls up a shuto -- an 18 inch knife -- from it's scabbard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Contact your associate in New York and tell him to hand my plate over to Abolofia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing from Kobo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have betrayed the syndicate and personally dishonored me.  I would rather the deal fell through than...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards walk over and turn Kobo around.  His back is t Sugai.  Sugai runs the sword across the nape of Kobo's neck drawing blood.  The guards tighten their grip on Kobo's arms.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: can't believe Sugai's going to kill him.  Nick starts to get up, Ich stops him. Kobo realizes Sugai isn't just threatening him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'll arrange it.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Kobo is led back into the room by two guards.  The guards shove him down to the floor.  His hands are still bound. Nick walks over and stands above him.  He doesn't say a word.  Just stands above him.  Then, Nick pulls spare change from his pocket and slowly drops the coins, one by one, in front of Kobo's face, like Kobo did to him.  He walks away. Sugai steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abolofia's person has received the plate.  It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens at the far end of the room.  It's Kobo's girlfriend, the one Nick and Ich had been following. She starts toward Kobo; a lieutenant intercepts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) I wanted you to see him like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Let him go, father.

dialogues.speaker: ON ICH
dialogues.text: realizing she's Sugai's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) You're too old...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai turns away and picks up the sword.  The guards clutch Kobo.  Sugai's going to kill Kobo after all. The girl screams at him to stop.  Sugai's oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't our deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want him dead too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a court convicts him.  He belongs to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long pause.  Then, something unusual happens. Sugai tells the lieutenant to unfasten Kobo's wrist.  Whe he does, Sugai hands Kobo the sword and demands that he cut off his finger. This is Yubitsume:  the ritual act within the Yakuza of slicing the joint of the little finger to atone for a mistake. Kobo, not believing in this ancient tradition, refuses. Sugai nods to a guard who places Kobo's finger on the table.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: stares defiantly at Sugai.  He doesn't even wince as the blade slices off his finger.  The guard hands Sugai the finger in a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Nick) If anything happens to Abolofia or my plate, detective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on Nick then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it bursts out of a tunnel on it's way to Tokyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo is sitting by the window, his hands cuffed in front of him.  Another pair of cuffs chain him to the arm rest. Nick pours a drink from an airline-sized bottle of Scotch He holds it out to... Ich.  It's his first drink in a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one, compadre... Kampai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kampai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink glasses.  Ich drinks it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took 12 years to make it, you could take five minutes to drink it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did great, Ichiro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called Ohashi, he'll be waiting. (smiling) I like him waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needs ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the bar car, leaving Kobo and Nick alone. Kobo looks out the window at the people working the rice paddies, then back down the aisle at the Salarymen in their identical suits, then at the women separated from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugly... A couple of thousand years they've been bound by these little rules.  Looking in.  Always afraid. Ugly little lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it, I already took the tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a lucky man.  Where you come from a man can stand out.  It's expected.  Here a man is made to look a fool for standing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick isn't paying much attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your friend, Joyce.  You're lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'm on a roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's such a long way home for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time, I've got plenty of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raucous SALARYMAN comes down the aisle, singing an Enka swaying with the train, bumping into seats.  A common enough sight and ignored by the rest of the passengers. The Salaryman stumbles and falls across Nick's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping him up) Hey, hey, come on, blow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Salaryman bows deep.  Nick ignores it.  The man moves on.  Kobo looks out the window, the train begins to SLOW as it approaches the next station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly) This is my stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks up to see Kobo calmly fingering a lock of blon hair tied with black ribbon.  Joyce's ribbon.  Joyce's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks down the car.  The drunk Salaryman who stumble over Nick is quite sober.  He made the hand-off to Kobo. Kobo holds out his wrists.  Nick hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly) I'll kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, reluctantly, unlocks both sets of cuffs.  The train pulls into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the plate from your pal, Sugai.  When you get it, you get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo gets up, starts down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugai won't give it to me, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take it from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo gets off the train.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: follows him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION
dialogues.text: Kobo get into a waiting Jaguar.  Four guards nearby.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Nick runs down the length of the car trying to keep the Jaguar in sight as the train pulls out... the car is gone

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: bursts into the packed bar car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ichiro?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns around.  No Ich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slows into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shoves past the passengers lined up in the vestibule ignoring a conductor's angry shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train stops.  Nick flies out and starts running, dodging the crowd. Three uniformed policemen, including Ohashi's assistant, hurry toward him; they're dismayed to find that Kobo is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ohashi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of offering him help, the policemen grab him and slap a pair of handcuffs on Nick's wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: HOLDING CELL
dialogues.text: Nick, waiting alone in the cell.  It's been hours.  A doo at the end of the hall opens. Ohashi stops in front of his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your plane leaves at six.  Two officers will escort you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, Ohashi, I need your help.  Let me out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had my help, detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything happens to her while I'm here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Do you know where she is, detective?  Do you know how to find her?  Even where to start?  We will find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get to Sugai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohashi keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OHASHI!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LOUD clank of metal on metal.  Ohashi's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at the top of his lungs) OHASHI!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on Nick, his fingers squeezing the bars in rage, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flood rice paddies stretch to the distance on either side of the road.  We PAN over to Kobo at a phone kiosk outsid a gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Yes.  Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo's girl, Sugai's daughter, hangs up the phone.  She's been on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open.  Sugai is sitting on the floor.  Th girl is carrying a tray of tea.  Beneath the tray, we spo something else -- the butt of a short-bladed tanto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car rolls through the service gate.  We see Nick inside the car along with two police guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white room.  No chairs.  Jet engines can be HEARD through the walls.  Nick is sitting on the floor, defeated.  He doesn't look up when he hears someone enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you one thing.  You can't solve a thing sitting on your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks up.  Ich is in uniform.  A revolver and batton hang from his white web gear.  His undershirt bulges through his khaki shirt.  He looks ridiculous.  Nick has never seen a more beautiful sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich is driving.  Nick is seated behind a cage in the back seat.  His hands are cuffed.  Ich is driving through the freight area towards a perimeter guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was ready to have your ass for taking off on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed them.  An hour from the train station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need the plate to negotiate with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car slows.  Ich speaks rapidly to the guard showing him his papers.  The guard takes a good hard look at Nick Time stands still... He waves them through.  Nick can breath again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Ichiro, you just burned your bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich is silent for a moment.  He hands Nick's Beretta back through the partition.  So it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks for Ich's eyes in the rearview mirror.  The little cop keeps driving, his eyes on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Ich are standing outside their car.  The Police radio crackles from inside.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: A large crowd gathered outside of Sugai's estate.  Police have cordoned off the area.  An empty ambulance is parked out front with various other cars:  Debonnaire's, Cadillac's... A boy in shorts is endlessly bouncing a bal against the compound wall.  Whatever happened is long over. Ich flips off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone attacked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we've got nothing to negotiate with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car streaks across endless fields.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Nick is at the wheel.  He rubs the sleep from his eyes. Ich is slumped down in the seat watching the road. Ich pulls out a cigarette.  Nick lights it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce told me about your family. It's tough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich looks up surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (beat) You have one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wife.  She left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich glances over at Nick, then back at the road. Nicks rubs out his cigarette and presses down on the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, contemporary house perched on a dry piece of land.  A paved road, lined with dense foliage runs on a berm between the flooded rice paddies.

dialogues.speaker: ON NICK AND ICH
dialogues.text: sitting in the car watching from a hillside turnoff. There's no easy way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich hands Charlie his shuto -- an 18 inch long knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tucks the shuto inside his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick opens up his door and climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Nick, we can't lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're the biggest things to hit this town since Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: THE DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: leading to the house lined with foliage.  The rice paddie on either side.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND ICH
dialogues.text: making their way through the waist high water.

dialogues.speaker: TWO WORKERS
dialogues.text: with their hoes make their way into the water.  They don' see our cops.

dialogues.speaker: OUR COPS
dialogues.text: making their way along the edge of the road.  The SOUND o a motorcycle coming.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOTORCYCLE RIDER
dialogues.text: slows and drops a gear as he turns off the main road and onto the dirt berm toward the house.  He's one of Kobo's Bosozoku -- a long way from the streets of Tokyo. The rider comes around the bend to see --

dialogues.speaker: A COP
dialogues.text: standing in a uniform.  Ich.  For a moment he doesn't kno what to do.  Then, he draws a pistol from his belt and accelerates toward Ich.

dialogues.speaker: ICH
dialogues.text: stands his ground as the bike closes in.  The biker takes aim. Ich drops off to the side as --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: rises from a ditch and swings a hoe at the rider as he passes, catching the man across the face.  The rider drop like a swatted fly.  The biker's momentum carries it a fe yards before it falls and skids to a halt. Nick hurries to the bike. Ich drags the biker off the road, then catches up to his partner.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND ICH
dialogues.text: raise the heavy bike.  Nick mounts.  He takes the riders helmet and goggles from Ich, and puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doesn't know exactly.  He taps the bike into gear, i torques like a mule.  There's a lot more juice here than he's used to. Nick fishtails for a minute, then gets the hang of it. Ich heads off taking another route.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO AND SUGAI'S DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: are putting the last of their belongings into a suitcase. She hands him the plate -- Sugai's plate. Kobo kisses her as he slips it into his breast pocket. The SOUND of a motorcycle approaching from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo steps out, and not recognizing Nick, raises his hand to greet what he thinks is one of his men.

dialogues.speaker: ON NICK
dialogues.text: bearing down on Kobo.

dialogues.speaker: ON KOBO
dialogues.text: as Nick keeps coming.  He is unable to see clearly until Nick is almost on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: dumps the bike at the foot of the stairs and leaps on Kobo. Nick and Kobo roll off the narrow porch.  Nick breaks free.  He isn't fighting fair this time.  He slams his foot into Kobo's face and ribs.  Kobo tries to get up, bu Nick knees him in the chin. A woman cries out in Japanese.  Nick turns to see

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: standing at the top of the steps.  A biker is pressing th muzzle of a Sig-Saur assault rifle on her.  Kobo's girl i beside them holding a small pistol.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: gets to his feet.  The biker tosses Kobo the rifle.  Kobo works the charging lever and holds the weapon at his side He has all the time in the world. Kobo whirls and kicks Nick in the groin.  Nick falls to his knees in agony. Kobo towers above Nick as he did in the alley in New York

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still on your knees, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kobo walks off, his back to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing you can do for me anymore.  I have the plate.  Sugai's dead.  No there is something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up to the steps to Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell me who I should shoot first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick struggles to get to his feet.  Kobo turns and faces Nick at the foot of the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ICH
dialogues.text: appears behind Kobo and takes him down with an amazing display of baton work that shows a lifetime of training. He grabs the gun.  A biker bursts out of the door.  Ich fires, hitting him in the thigh.  He drops his gun.

dialogues.speaker: SUGAI'S DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: grabs the gun.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: tackles her, and wrestles the gun away.  She grabs for it Nick slugs her.

dialogues.speaker: A GUN BLAST
dialogues.text: Ich is hit in the back of his shoulder, falls onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: the shooter, is holding a pistol -- a Glock 17 automatic. He fires at

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND JOYCE
dialogues.text: who scramble for cover.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: continues firing as he climbs onto a motorcycle.  He pops the clutch and flies off down the road.  Nick fires after him, but Kobo's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ich) You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joyce) Call for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick mounts the other bike, and puts the turbo charged rocket into gear.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Rain pours down as Kobo turns onto the main road.  He opens up the throttle, and in less than a second, he's a screaming dot in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: comes around the same corner.  His bike fishtails and slides out from under him.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Kobo tears past a police car.  The police car takes off after him.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOOTHILLS
dialogues.text: A series of steep switchbacks traverse the steep, densely forested hills. Kobo's bike flies up the road.  The police car can't keep up, begins losing ground.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: going flat out, falling further and further behind. Kobo's going to escape.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: Nick, bent low, shoots past the cop car.  His left arm is scraped and bloody.

dialogues.speaker: ON KOBO
dialogues.text: glancing back, to see Nick gaining on him.  Kobo's pleased.  He gives it more gas.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: pulling eight-five... ninety... one hundred.  The rain stings his face.  It's hard to keep his eye open.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOOTHILLS
dialogues.text: Kobo leaning into one of the steep turns, climbing higher and higher toward the clouds clinging to the top of the peak.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: is gaining on him.  He HEARS something coming up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: A BOSOZOKU
dialogues.text: the one Ich shot in the leg, is closing fast on his tail.

dialogues.speaker: ON NICK
dialogues.text: as the biker draws even.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIKER
dialogues.text: pulls out his long knife and slashes at Nick's shoulder. Nick drops back causing him to miss.  The biker drops back.  Nick tries to speed up, but the biker sticks with him.  He's a good rider, this boy.  Very, very good. The biker moves in again, blade drawn.

dialogues.speaker: NICK SEES
dialogues.text: something the biker doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: A TRUCK
dialogues.text: coming around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: swerves to avoid it at the last moment.  The biker reacts too late and runs --

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE GLEAMING
dialogues.text: radiator of the two ton truck, and disappears beneath its wheels.

dialogues.speaker: ON KOBO
dialogues.text: around the bend, glancing back.  Empty road.  He eases up on the throttle -- a free man... He circles back only to see

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: burst around the corner charging toward him at a hundred- and-twenty miles per hour, in the driving rain.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: waits and waits.  Nick draws closer.  Then, Kobo tears of back down the mountain, shooting past Nick. Nick brakes... He slows down, and starts to turn, but the wheels whirl on the gravel and the bike goes into a skid, heading right for the edge of the road.

dialogues.speaker: NICK'S MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: flying over the edge of the road, and down the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: THE EDGE OF THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Nick, lying on his stomach at the edge of the cliff, his arm is probably broken. He tries to get up with a one arm push up.  It's hopeless His head falls into a puddle of water. The WHINE of an approaching motorcycle.  Kobo has come back for him. Nick, in excruciating pain, struggles for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: bearing down on Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: struggling to get his gun.  Finally he does.  But it's caked in mud.  If the barrel is stuffed it will explode. Nick has to take the chance.

dialogues.speaker: ON KOBO
dialogues.text: Closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: aims as best he can and fires.  The mud caked gun explode in his hand.  Nick screams in agony.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: pulls his bike up inches in front of Nick's head.  Nick seems to be bleeding everywhere:  his hand, his nose, his mouth, the side of his head... Kobo's face and neck is caked in blood from when Nick bea him. The rain pours down. He picks up the gun.  Points it at Nick, squeezes the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Bang... bang...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the gun in front of Nick's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of approaching Police SIRENS. Kobo swings the bike around, goes a hundred yards down th road, then swings back. Kobo guns the engine.  He gain speed... thirty, thirty- five.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: struggles to get up.  He can't.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: opening the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: crawling a few inches, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: twenty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: reaches into his coat and pulls Ich's 18 inch shuto out. He rolls away at the last moment, slashing Kobo's ankle a he races past.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: screams in pain.  He tries to stop too suddenly.  The bik flips over.  Kobo flies into the air then hits the pavement on his side and rolls a few yards down the road. He stops on his back.  It's lucky he's alive. The SOUND of fast approaching police SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLATE
dialogues.text: has fallen out of Kobo's jacket.  It rests in the road, halfway between the two men.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: crawls toward it on his belly.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: mustering all his strength, struggles across the road on all fours.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO
dialogues.text: crawling snake-like.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: still moving, his arms and legs feel like lead.

dialogues.speaker: KOBO'S FINGERS
dialogues.text: as they reach for the plate.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: grabs Kobo's wrist forcing him to drop the plate.  Nick picks up a rock.  It looks as if he's going to smash Kobo's head.  Instead, he brings it down on the plate, shattering it in a half-dozen pieces. Nick tosses the pieces in front of Kobo's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, exhausted, slowly falls onto his back.  He looks over at Kobo, their faces are inches apart.  Nick makes a slashing mark with his index finger above his eyebrows. The same gesture Kobo made to Nick through the two-way mirror in New York. Nick passes out.  His eyes shut... the screen...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: The SOUND of three police cars screeching to a halt.  The SOUNDS of the police SIRENS winding down. The SIRENS get softer mixing with the SOUND of RINGING phones, CLACKING typewriters, VOICES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty identical desks.  Fifty identically dressed men in white shirts and ties work under fluorescent lights.

dialogues.speaker: OHASHI
dialogues.text: is at his desk studying a report. Suddenly, the lights go out.  The fan's stop, so do the electric typewriters. Ohashi looks up to see --

dialogues.speaker: ICH
dialogues.text: walking toward him down the long aisle, his left arm is bandaged, his right hand handcuffed to Kobo on crutches. Ich silently leads the captured man down the long aisle t Ohashi's desk.

dialogues.speaker: ICH
